results.title: On the nose
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human senses”.
An introduction to the sense of smell. Animation is used to illustrate the operations of the smell receptors in the nasal cavities and how this information is processed by the brain. Clearly defines the concept of smelling and recognition of odours.

results.title: The Human body: the making of the TV series [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Liesel Evans, BBC and Learning Channel
results.brief_description: The final episode in “The Human body” series takes the viewer on a fascinating journey behind how the series was created and how they were able to create the impressive special effects. Presented by Robert Winston.

results.title: The Human body: how it works
results.brief_description: Designed for primary students in Years 5 and 6, this is an introduction to the component parts of the human body; how these parts interact and are interdependent. Short segments explain the skeleton, muscles, nerves, brain, blood, heart, digestive system, waste disposal and the lungs. A Teacher’s Guide suggests follow-up activities and discussion questions for use in the classroom.

results.title: The Human animal: a personal view of the human species. - Part 1. (X)
results.creator_credit: Clive Bromhall, John MacNish, Mike Beynon and BBC
results.brief_description: Desmond Morris attempts to illustrate how the many ways human beings behave across cultures have their roots in our “animal” past. The three programs are: “The Language of the body” which examines the origins of our body language and how body language signals vary across cultures. “The Hunting ape” examines how our primeval hunting habits have been mainfested in activities such as sport and mob behaviour. “The Human zoo” looks at how urban humans deal with their tribalistic instincts. This episode contains some full frontal nudity.

results.title: The House of exorcism = Lisa and the devil
results.creator_credit: Mario Bava, Mickey Lion and Leone International Film
results.brief_description: Originally filmed as ‘Lisa and the Devil’, Mario Bava’s creepy and atmospheric chiller was re-cut for the American market, with a demonic possession sub-plot (directed by Mickey Lion), added to capitalise on the success of ‘The Exorcist’. As it stands now this rather disjointed film stars Elke Sommers as Lisa, a woman holidaying in an unspecified European city. Along her travels she begins to notice a strange man (Telly Savalas, sporting his trademark chuppa-chup) following her, who carries around with him a creepy life like mannequin who may or may not be Satan. Lisa suddenly begins to convulse and is rushed off to hospital. Her condition is soon diagnosed as demonic possession (vomiting, profanity, etc.) and a priest (Robert Alda) is brought in to help. These scenes are intercut with strange dream-like sequences of Lisa in an unspecified gothic mansion, where a mentally disturbed man (Alessio Orano) lives with his blind mother and their butler (Savalas again), who may or may not be Satan. Also known as: ‘La casa dell’esorcismo’, ‘Lisa and the Devil’, ‘The devil in the house of exorcism’, and ‘The devil and the dead’. Cast also includes Alida Valli and Sylva Koscina.

results.title: The Avengers
results.brief_description: Espionage, fantasy and a healthy dose of unresolved sexual tension abound in this slick series that has proved to be one of the most successful television series of all time. Originally aired in the UK between January 1961 and September 1969 and comprising of 161 episodes, the series went on to screen in a record number of 120 countries. John Steed (Patrick McNee) was always an Avenger, appearing in all episodes - Mrs Peel (Diana Rigg) was his third and most enduring partner. The series was resurrected in the mid 1970s, episodes of which are also available in the collection.

results.title: Death at bargain prices. Castle De'ath. The Master minds
results.creator_credit: Julian Wintle and Associated British Picture Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Avengers”.
Death at bargain prices: When a murdered agent is found carrying a receipt from the children’s section of Pinter’s department store Mrs Peel finds herself working in lingerie. Steed discovers the mysterious disappearance of food from the store as well as regular customer Professor Popple. “Castle De’ath”: Mrs Peel goes undercover as a publicity consultant with ABORCASHAAT (Advisory Bureau on Refurbishing Castles and Stately Homes as a Tourist Attraction) at De’ath Castle; Steed is a kilt wearing historian investigating the 13th Laird of De’ath, Black Jimmy. There’s ghosts of traitors past, mysterious pipers, a dungeon and plenty of tartan from the Avengers. Gordon Jackson stars. “The Master minds”: When Sir Clive Todd is found to be involved with a string of burglaries the government is keen to solve matters quietly and quickly. Mrs Peel plays Florence Nightingale to the amnesiac Sir Clive who was shot in the latest robbery and Steed attempts to find the mastermind behind the successful outfit.

group_siblings.title: The Hour that never was. Murdersville
The House that Jack built. Never, never say die
The Town of no return. The Gravediggers. The Cybernauts
Two's a crowd. Mission highly impropable

results.title: The Town of no return. The Gravediggers. The Cybernauts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Avengers”.
The Town of no return: Steed and Mrs Peel are sent to the sleepy seaside town of Little Bazeley to investigate the disappearance of four agents. In a town where nobody is what they seem, Peel and Steed disguise themselves as a primary school teacher and property developer and stay at a local hotel called the Gremlin. The highlight of the episode is a leather clad Peel tied down with horse riding apparel. “The Gravediggers”: there’s interference in sector three on the radar, leading to a fear of undetected nuclear weapons. Steed and Mrs Peel head to the town of Prinby, located in the heart of sector three and the burial place of Dr Hubert Marlowe, recently deceased expert in the field. Peel goes undercover as a Nurse at a hospice for railwaymen while Steed visits the benefactor of the establishment. Highlights of the episode include a miniature train ride and Mrs Peel tied to the railway tracks, complete with accompanying music, fitting for a damsel in distress. “The Cybernauts”: three electronics experts are killed by a tall man with brute strength and the number is increasing. They all had an appointment with the Harachi Corporation, an electronics company who have created a new circuit element for transistors. The trail leads Steed and Mrs Peel to United Automation where a wheelchair bound scientist is building an army of radio controlled cybernauts. A highlight of the episode involves Mrs Peel doing karate - in a skirt.

results.title: The Icicle thief
results.creator_credit: Maurizio Nichetti, Aries Film and Bambu
results.brief_description: In his ingenious comedy, Nichetti has takena wide-eyed look at Italian cinema, past and present, and has staggered back from the vision, his mind brimming with invention. On one hand, there’s Italy’s hallowed neo-realist past; grainy, black-and-white postwar images full of stubbled, unemployed fathers, sacrficial mothers and brave bustling priests. On the other, there are the television shows that “present” these films: a wasteland of lofty critics, only too willing to interpret a director’s deepest motives and intentions- even to the director himself. Nichetti has created a hilarious movie that mixes the world of cinema and television into a comic masterpiece.
